text: Howard Craghead (May 25, 1908 – July 14, 1962), nicknamed "Judge", was a baseball player who played professional baseball in the 1930s. Craghead mainly played in the minor leagues, for the Toledo Mud Hens. Craghead did manage to pitch 23 innings during his career however for the Cleveland Indians, with no decisions and an earned run average of 6.26. He later became a Lieutenant Commander in the U.S. Navy during World War II. In 1974, Craghead was inducted into the Fresno County Athletic Hall of Fame. == References == == External links == * * Category:1908 births Category:1962 deaths Category:Cleveland Indians players Category:Toledo Mud Hens players Category:San Diego Padres (minor league) players Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Baseball players from California Category:People from Selma, California
title: Howard Craghead
